intro: Coluteastrum sulcatum, commonly known as the scarlet bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and elongated, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine, waxy hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces distinctive, inflated pods that contain several seeds. Coluteastrum sulcatum is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
